title: Interlune plans to gather scarce lunar Helium-3 for quantum computing on Earth
summary:
GOLDEN, Colorado — Interlune, a Seattle-based company of former Blue Origin technologists, has set its sights on the moon’s supply of Helium-3 — a rare heavy isotope deposited into lunar […]
The post Interlune plans to gather scarce lunar Helium-3 for quantum computing on Earth appeared first on SpaceNews.
